avalancheActivity.comment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack on sunny slopes, caution is to be exercised in particular on very steep slopes below approximately 2600 m, and at the base of rock walls. In steep gullies moist avalanches can reach medium size.
The wind slabs of the last few days are lying on weak layers in high Alpine regions. They can still be released in some cases in particular on north to east to southeast facing aspects above approximately 2500 m.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. This applies in particular in the early morning.
avalancheActivity.highlights: More moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In addition the clearly visible wind slabs should be taken into account.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. Individual weak layers exist in the snowpack on wind-loaded slopes. Adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: The conditions are spring-like. Less snow than usual is lying. The high temperatures gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.

tendency.comment: The weather will be mild. The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual strengthening of the near-surface layers.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. As a consequence of warming during the day more small and medium-sized moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Caution is to be exercised below very steep, sunny starting zones that have retained the snow thus far.
The wind slabs of the last few days are lying on weak layers in high Alpine regions. They can still be released in some cases in particular on north to east to southeast facing aspects above approximately 2500 m.
There is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. This applies in particular in the early morning.
avalancheActivity.highlights: More moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses. Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released especially by large additional loads on shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The conditions are wintry at high altitude. In particular adjacent to ridgelines snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.
Low and intermediate altitudes and very steep sunny slopes: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2600 m. The conditions are spring-like.
In particular at low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released by people in particular on very steep shady slopes. The avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular in the vicinity of peaks.
As a consequence of warming during the day individual small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular in case of releases originating from very steep, sunny starting zones that have retained the snow thus far.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Moist snow slides and avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Weak layers exist in the centre of the snowpack on steep shady slopes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack in particular on steep east, south and west facing slopes below approximately 2500 m.
On steep sunny slopes as well as at low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Very early morning: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
As a consequence of warming during the day individual mostly small moist snow slides and avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in isolated cases by winter sport participants in particular on very steep shady slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snowpack is largely stable. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to slight moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2500 m.
In all regions only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
